sample_docs: Team Mission At Scylla, our mission is to empower the private security industry with next-gen AI solutions. And with every new product in mind, we strive to make safety more accessible to those who could not afford it otherwise. Core values At the core of Scylla team there are four main values: D iscipline C ommunication C ooperation P artnership Team Members Albert Stepanyan CEO AND FOUNDER Hey there, I am Albert, A.K.A. Cyberhulk. Coming from Military and tech background and having deep expertise in building tech businesses such as Develandoo, I decided to combine those skills and create Scylla - World's best gun detection system. Ara Ghazaryan TECHNICAL CO-FOUNDER AND CHIEF DATA SCIENTIST I hold a Ph.D. degree in Optics and Molecular Physics. Over the course of 9 years, I have been a postdoctoral researcher at Munich Technical University, Pusan National University, and National Taiwan University. Being a physics guy with a background in optics and imaging techniques, I faced the problem of image analysis very early in my career, back at National Taiwan University, where I first built and then utilized optical systems that were aimed to address various biomedical diagnostic problems. The main challenge was first to learn how to distinguish images corresponding to pathogenic tissue samples and quantify compounds based on their optical features, followed by the even more challenging task of teaching the computer to do it automatically and even better than a human would do. All this experience, later on, came in handy, developing a sophisticated computer vision-based security suite called Scylla. Alfonso Lomeli Chief Financial Officer I am an experienced Director of Financial Planning and Human Resources with a demonstrated history of working in the IT industry. I'm skilled in negotiations, leadership, project management, people management, and strategic planning. I am currently Director of Financial Planning and Human Resources at Kichink, an e-commerce platform launched in Mexico in 2013. Armen Gabrielyan Chief Operating Officer I am Armen, COO at Scylla. I started my career in 2007 as Full Stack Engineer, after which I became CTO of a local startup in Armenia. Then I moved to Germany and worked at Allianz Group as Lead Architect. That's when we decided to found Develandoo AI Innovation Lab. Two years later Albert and Ara initiated Scylla's development, and I decided to join in because actually the potential and impact of AI on our everyday lives is indescribable, and the matters of public safety and security, and anything related to protecting people and saving lives, are of utmost importance. Ashot Harutyunyan CTO and Solution Architect I am Solution Architect at Scylla. I have more than 5 years of experience in designing and developing enterprise software solutions. I have worked abroad at different international companies such as Allianz Group in Germany, Europe's biggest insurance company. Additionally, I am a certified AWS (Amazon Web Services) engineer and an architect in high loaded distributed cloud systems. Zhora Gevorgyan lead computer vision engineer I am Computer Vision Engineer with 5+ years of experience in the field. I worked on the development of military software designed to improve performance of military equipment and training simulation software. I'm the creator of Facehub application which is a 3D face reconstruction software. There I designed state-of-the-art algorithms for real-time face reenactment and expression transfer from the source to target actor, facial landmark detection and face tracking algorithms, using modern machine learning techniques. I had a key role in developing Pixomatic application. I'm Lead Computer Vision Engineer at Scylla. Armen Ghambaryan Lead Deep Learning Engineer I'm a lead deep learning engineer with more than 4 years of experience in the field. I have been developing analytical systems based on state-of-the-art machine learning models for banking, healthcare, media, and public security industries. Sergey Ohanyan C++ Engineer I'm a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering, previously working as an engineer in civil aviation industry. Having gained enough knowledge in software engineering I joined Scylla as a computer vision engineer. Karen Nikoghosyan C++ Engineer I am a Software Developer with 2 years of experience. I have a strong knowledge of Data Structures and Algorithms. I graduated from Polytechnic University. I'm highly experienced in desktop software development. I have a good algorithmic background as well as good object-oriented design and analysis skills. Anna Sargsyan Computer vision engineer I'm Anna, I have Bachelor's degree in Informatics and Applied Mathematics. After working in system programming laboratory as a software engineer I joined Scylla as a computer vision engineer. Liana Tumikyan Frontend developer I'm a front-end developer in Scylla with more than 2 years of experience on web and hybrid mobile app development. I'm working on Scylla's dashboards and the mobile app, aspiring to combine usability with visual design and trying to find solutions to translate our company and customer needs into functional and appealing interactive applications. Hovig Kouyoumjian Technical Support Engineer I am an experienced technical support engineer with a demonstrated history of working in the software industry. I hold a Bachelor's Degree in computer engineering with numerous international certifications. I am skilled in building customer relationships, preparing technical documentation, providing swift client assistance, monitoring server performance, and implementing automation. I act as Technical Support Engineer at Scylla. Arayik Sargsyan Technical Support Engineer I am Arayik, Technical Support Specialist at Scylla. IT has always been my dream and thanks to Scylla, this dream has come true. I am an energetic, resourceful, creative and inquisitive person who loves to work and develop new and original ways to achieve their goals. Julia Titova Chief Marketing Officer For over 7 years, I've been passionately engrossed in marketing, partnerships, and PR for companies on different stages of their growth and across various industries. I believe there are no impossible tasks once there's the right attitude, and as a team you are set to achieve your goals. Anastasia Shcherbich Marketing Manager Over 2 years ago, I began my marketing experience working for a B2B market, and ever since then, I have developed a passion for helping businesses grow and expand their horizons. My love to marketing also inspired me to finish the M.A in Marketing Management. I enjoy digging into multiple areas that allow me to express my creativity, solve problems, and develop new strategies. Tatyana Kozlova Sales Operations Manager Experienced in Sales Process Implementation, Analytics, and Sales Operations, Channel/Distributor program development, Budgeting & Revenue Forecasting. I had a great chance to live and work in different parts of the world aiming to maximize sales for the businesses I was engaged in. I am eager to learn each and every day. Misha Kalhin Global Channel Partner Manager I'm an IT professional with 15 years of international experience (US - China - CIS). I've been involved in various areas of software product development and helped companies grow their business, startups as well as multinationals. My main strength is storytelling - conveying the exact message to the right person. My passion is working with niche products that solve real problems and make the world a better place. Davit Tumasyan VP of Product and Product Enablement I am VP of Product and Product Enablement at Scylla. I am a former Chief Architect and Software Engineer with over 10 years' experience in designing and developing large scale applications and big data solutions. By combining my technical, management and business experience my aim is to develop Scylla AI into a robust solution that can cater to the needs of diverse clients and markets. Kris Greiner VP of Sales North America I am a founder of Solbreez which specializes in "best-in-class†Intelligent Security Solutions. I've been offering the world's most advanced technology solutions to Fortune 1000, K-16 Education, and Public Sector since 1994. Notable accomplishments include being a consultant and solution provider to many of the largest Energy Companies and Educational Organizations in North America. I'm managing a network of selected Scylla resellers/technology partners who have a desire to provide their customers with the most advanced military grade weapon detection solution available. Michael Seidler Channel Partner Manager North America I am an experienced law enforcement investigator and public safety expert with a track record of championing leading edge technology to advance the mission of protecting life, property and addressing security concerns. I have provided solutions for private enterprise, local, state and federal entities to address critical gaps in security coverage and maximizes stakeholder's investments by mitigating risk. I hold an MBA with an emphasis in International Business from Saint Mary's University, London U.K. and have worked with many organizations with a global presence. Brennan Borgestad Business Development Manager North America Coming from the traditional IT space, it is exciting to branch out into leading edge technology. Scylla's AI suites help companies advance their existing legacy system while eliminating false alarms and human errors. Scylla is truly an innovative company at the forefront of AI and machine learning software. Andrey Akopyan DIRECTOR FOR INTEGRATION AND MAINTENANCE I have worked exclusively in the low voltage industry since 2006 specializing in Network Infrastructure, Access Control, Intrusion, and Surveillance. My team and I manage 5000+ connections globally, ensuring situational awareness and security. I also specialize in large scale structured cabling and the combined skill in both integration and physical installation of components has allowed me to cater to our clients on every level. Jairo Soler VP of LATAM Sales I am an Industrial Engineer experienced in Project Management and Strategic Sales with 20+ years of experience in the IT and software development industries. I also possess practical and managerial skills in project planning, negotiation, and business development. I am a passionate advocate for innovation within organizations as a sustainable strategy for creating new businesses and markets. Latin America faces particular challenges, which is why I believe Scylla has a huge opportunity in this region by empowering the private security sector with the best AI-powered solutions helping local authorities overcome threats to their citizens' safety. Victoria Dimchoglo Sales Development Representative I am a dedicated Sales Development Representative with an international background and particular interest in the IT industry. Upon graduation from the Faculty of International Affairs, I decided to go into the sales sphere and spent over 3 years now learning and working in this realm. Shynkai Sher Mohammad Sales Development Representative I am a proactive and results-driven Sales Development Representative at Scylla. I'm eager to establish, develop, and maintain positive business and customer relationships. Additionally, I coordinate sales efforts with team members and different departments. My credo is, "Sell the problem you solve, not the product.†Ray McKenzie Advisor for Growth and Marketing I am a founder of a technology management consulting group providing services in the private and public sector called Red Beach Advisors. I'm an executive consultant specializing in strategy, digital transformation, operational excellence and performance management, and driving efficiency in all business areas. My expertise includes strategy development, operational excellence, process improvement and implementation (Lean Six Sigma/ITIL), agile project management (Certified ScrumMaster), customer success and service management, workforce analytics and behavioral analysis, talent evaluation and personnel management, organizational training & development, change management, M&A Integration. I'm an advisory board member at Scylla providing additional technology strategy, operational insight, and guidance in scaling the company. Oliver Schneider ADVISOR FOR SPECIAL OPERATIONS I am the Special Operations Advisor and Partner for Scylla Germany. I'm the founder and managing partner of RiskWorkers GmbH, based in Munich. I started my career as an officer in the German army where I served in the paratroopers and other regiments before switching to the German Special Forces Commando (KSK). I also took part in multiple special overseas deployments. I left my career as an officer in 2001 to work in the corporate security division of a DAX-listed company to gain professional experience in the civilian field. I stayed within the company and moved to the Business Development department, where I was responsible for trend assessment and early warning signals. I have been working as a security, risk, and crisis management consultant since 2006. I have gained international experience as a Risk Consultant in Afghanistan, Algeria, Brazil, Iraq, Iran, Yemen, Colombia, Mexico, Pakistan, and Russia (Caucasus). Rafi Kurkdjian ADVISOR FOR TALENT MANAGEMENT AND STRATEGY Rafi Kurkdjian's passion in life is to connect people with their dream job! He has been in talent acquisition for the past 25 years and has worked for major corporations (Symantec & ATT) and smaller start-ups (YP.com & NetZero). More recently, Rafi led ServiceTitan's remarkable growth from 34 to over 800 employees in less than 4 years! Rafi is currently the VP of Talent at DISQO. Rafi is an alumni of California State Polytechnic University. In his free time, he loves spending time with his 2 young boys (13 & 9), and his precious daughter who is a freshman at San Diego State University. When Rafi is not hanging out with his kids, you will find him on the golf course or playing poker with his friends. Armen Kherlopian ADVISOR FOR DATA STRATEGY AND ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE Dr. Armen Kherlopian is a world class data and strategy leader as demonstrated by repeatedly driving new venture growth and ecosystem impact. Moreover, his industry experience is cross-sector including Global Fortune 100 Companies, elite asset managers, startups as well as government organizations such as the FDA and NASA. As a thought leader, he co-authored the Field Guide to Data Science, used widely in academia and industry alike, and co-founded the Data Science Bowl, which is the largest data challenge for social good. Armen is an awardee of the U.S. National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship, U.S. Department of Energy Computational Science Graduate Fellowship, and is a U.S. delegate to the Lindau Nobel Laureates Meetings. He holds a BS and MS in Biomedical Engineering with a focus on Algorithms from Columbia University, a PhD in Biophysics with a focus on Machine Learning from Cornell University, and completed a fellowship in High Performance Computing and Artificial Intelligence at Princeton University. Community case study Sterling Consulting Envigado Get a quote Overview The idea is to utilize cameras that have large scale overview on public areas for social rules violation detection enforced by COVID-19 pandemic. Cameras of UAVs, installed on helicopters as well as solid mounted on tall buildings surveying large open air areas are to be used for non-compliance detection. The corresponding alert is to be sent to relevant authorities to take preventive actions. People without facial masks (in places where face mask usage is mandatory in open air) as well as obeying social distancing rules are detected in real-time. CHALLENGE Detection of individuals who do not wear face masks. Detection of social distance violation for a group of people. Send alert with visual information on violation, time, location. Bring corresponding CCTV streams on top of the others to raise awareness of surveying personnel. OUR SOLUTION Bring corresponding CCTV streams on top of the others to raise awareness of surveying personnel. Scylla crowd management module was used to calculate social distancing. Scylla dashboard and mobile apps used to send an alert to relevant personnel. Scylla was integrated into the existing CCTV surveillance system to raise awareness by enlarging the streams where a violation has been detected to make it easier for security personnel to identify the violation and take appropriate actions. Customer Testimonial Nilson Ortiz Managing Director Sterling Consulting Colombia Your problem and Scylla's solution Within Scylla there are several types of video analytics such as: biometric facial recognition, reading and identification of vehicles through the plates, detection of the non-use of masks, social distancing and in addition to that, detection of firearms and knives. So, a person who walks through the territory without using a mask, is the system able to detect it, because in Envigado it's forbidden to stay in public spaces without the use of a mask. Is it possible? It is indeed! The system analyzes the crowds in the scene and determines the people who do not have the mask, in which case, it generates an alert that is received at the monitoring center, so appropriate measures are taken. The Business Impacts of Threat Detection through Thermal and Fever Screening Get a quote Pandemic and the New World All companies and people are embarking on an uncharted journey towards a new normal together. The response to the pandemic was primarily reactive. Business leaders did not understand the impact. Organizations that have had to shutter their doors due to the pandemic are now looking at ways to protect themselves, their employees, their customers, from the new threats that are presented by the COVID-19 pandemic. Thermal screening is being explored as a way to detect potential virus carriers, as well as other threats affecting companies and people. How to Reopen Safely? Restarting and opening are not easy. There are new threats and safety concerns. Technology must be implemented. Airports, venues, and establishments have started to incorporate quick thermal scans of people to alleviate any concerns or possible threats from the possible spread of the virus. Thermal screening is one option that will play a key role in a safe reopening for organizations around the world. There are several symptoms of COVID-19, but an extreme and consistent fever is one known symptom of COVID-19. Company procedures are changing too. All employees, and specifically safety teams, now have added duties for their day to day activities. Their priorities are to assist in containing the spread of the virus and to help find ways to continue the operations, protect customers, and to provide consistent and safe services. This is not an easy adjustment. There are several proposed solutions and safety measures. The implementation of fever screening is core to businesses progressing in this new world. Scylla Thermal Scanner The Scylla Threat Detection AI, more specifically the Thermal Scanner System, is a technology that is becoming increasingly popular as more organizations look for ways to slow the spread of the virus. A challenge presented with thermal screening is the number of infected persons that have this symptom. An estimated 12-15% of infected COVID-19 carriers have this symptom and it does not completely eradicate the threat. You can quickly identify a person's temperature through Scylla. It is non-evasive. Scans in under one second. The solution can also be implemented to maintain social distancing measures. Before you choose to implement and employ thermal imaging systems, you should consider current and even future laws regulating technology use. First, under the Americans With Disabilities Act (and similar state laws within the US), measuring the body temperature of an employee is considered a medical examination and thus is subject to certain limitations. Along these lines, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) in the United States recently approved checking temperatures of employees and even suspending job offers to individuals who have a temperature in excess of 100.4 degrees. The EEOC justifies the use of such measurements now because of the "direct threat†of COVID-19 as a worldwide pandemic. The use of thermal screening and fever detection systems is not full proof, nor is it without its challenges. Some individuals may choose not to give the authorization to perform the scan. Some scanners may not provide accurate readings. Performing thermal screening can also become an additional burden on an employee doing their job....which now includes maintaining public safety. An estimated 12-15% of infected COVID-19 carriers have this symptom and it does not completely eradicate the threat The Future of Work The world has changed. Thermal screening is going to be a regular method used by companies. The pandemic is anticipated to be present for the next several quarters and maybe future years. Scylla has developed technology that can alleviate the challenges presented by having to urgently accommodate threat detection measures through thermal screening. Scylla's solutions are able to be implemented through your current thermal cameras and your regular security procedures and technology. By implementing threat detection measures utilizing Scylla's technology, you do not have to purchase handheld thermal scanners that are unverified or possibly avert the current health and safety requirements by not scanning at all. It is much easier and simplistic to detect threats such as fever screening, gun detection, threats of violence, and others through the comprehensive Scylla protection suite. The adjustments due to the pandemic, along with the ever-present previous threats, are resulting in companies having to evaluate their plan to address each challenge. Companies should begin to regularly address a full risk assessment for their business, employees, and customers and Scylla is available to assist your company move forward with its protection technology. Thermal screening is going to be a regular method used by companies for the foreseeable future.
